page.title: 04SERVICES TO NATEBY VILLAGE
page.content: THE SERVICES COMING IN TO THE VILLAGE ARE GOOD.EVERY MONDAY MR. BLADES FROM HAWES COMES SELLING FISH AND FRUIT. THE LIBRARY VAN FROM KENDAL COMES ONCE A FORTNIGHT. WEDNESDAY AND FRIDAY THE BAKER BELLS OF LAZONBY COME WITH BREAD AND CAKES. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY TWO BUTCHERS COME.THE COALMEN COME ONCE A FORTNIGHT. DUST-BINS ARE COLLECTED ON WEDNESDAY MORNING EACH WEEK. RINGTONS TEA DELIVER EACH WEDNESDAY FROM BARNARD CASTLE.THE LOCAL GARAGE RECEIVES SPARE PARTS, TOOLS ETC EACH DAY.A VAN CALLS ON LOCAL FARMS SELLING CATTLE MEDICINES, SHEEP DIP AND FARM SUPPLIES. THREE DAIRY MEN DELIVER MILK EACH MORNING. IN SUMMER A VAN COMES ONCE A WEEK SELLING ICE-CREAM AND SWEETS. WEEKLY DELIVERIES ARE MADE TO THE PUB AND GROCERIES TO THE SHOP.
